Interface DynamicGraph

All Superinterfaces:
Graph
All Known Implementing Classes:
MyGraph
public interface DynamicGraph extends Graph
Graph implementation which enables dynamic size of vertices.

  • Nested Class Summary

  • Method Details

    • addVertex

      void addVertex(DynamicGraph.Vertex vertex)
      Adds given vertex to this graph. If a vertex with same id already existed in this graph, overrides its label and weight.
      Parameters:
      vertex - Vertex to be added.

      vertexID2 - Second vertex id.

      Get the vertex in this graph with given ID.

      Returns:
      Vertex in this graph with given ID, or null if no such vertex exists.

    • filterVertices

      MyGraph filterVertices(String key, String filter)
      Filter the vertices by the given user-defined property and returns a subgraph of the graph.
      Parameters:
      key - Property name/key.
      filter - Property value.
      Returns:
      Filtered MyGraph;

    • exportMatrix

      double[][] exportMatrix()
      Constructs a double matrix with its first row and column showing vertex ids. The value at (0, 0) is always 0.0 and Infinity is used to represent no edge. 
      // Example
MyGraph graph = new MyGraph();
graph.addVertex(new Vertex(54));
graph.addVertex(new Vertex(41));
graph.addEdge(54, 41, 13.5);

// The matrix will be as
// 0.0    54.0        41.0
// 54.0   Infinity    13.5
// 41.0   Infinity    Infinity
      Returns:
      Adjacency matrix of this graph.

    • printGraph

      void printGraph()
      Prints this graph in adjacency list format. TODO: AbstractGraph importing style printing needed!!!
